snippet: Days after acquiring a group of stars from the Marlins, Toronto was said to have signed Melky Cabrera, who looked like a candidate for most valuable player until he failed a drug test.
abstract: MLB Roundup; Toronto Blue Jays reportedly sign outfielder Melky Cabrera, whose 2012 season was cut short by a 50-game suspension for a failed drug test, to a two-year deal worth $16 million; other baseball developments noted.
lead_paragraph: Days after acquiring a group of stars from the Marlins, Toronto was said to have signed Melky Cabrera, who looked like a candidate for most valuable player until he failed a drug test.

headline.seo: Blue Jays Said to Sign Melky Cabrera
headline.main: Blue Jays Are Said to Add Melky Cabrera to Their Haul
headline.print_headline: Blue Jays Are Said to Add Melky Cabrera to Their Haul
